nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api

Interface IOAIRepository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DnaExtractOAIRepository, DnaExtractPlateOAIRepository, GeneiousOAIRepository, SpecimenOAIRepository

    public interface IOAIRepository

    Call-back interface for OAI repositories. This is the only interface that OAI repositories must implement in order to plug into the OAI-PMH REST framework, although they can optionally implement a few other interfaces (e.g. IResumptionTokenParser).

    Life Cycle

    For each OAI-PMH request the REST layer cycles through the following calls against the repository:

    1. Call setRepositoryBaseUrl. This tells the repository under which base URL it operates. This allows the repository to generate XML with namespace declarations relative to the base URL. See also getXSDForMetadataPrefix.
    2. Call getResumptionTokenParser. This is a request to the repository to provide an instance IResumptionTokenParser, so the REST layer can decompose and validate the resumption token (if present).
    3. Call init. This allows the repository to initialize and prepare itself using the OAIPMHRequest object passed to the init method. The OAIPMHRequest object contains all information for the repository to carry out any of the six OAI-PMH protocol requests (GetRecord, ListRecords, ListSets, etc.).
    4. Call one of the six protocol request implementations. The exact method being called depends on the value of the verb argument in the request URL.
    5. Call done to signify that a response has been sent back to client and that the request cycle is complete.

    Besides implementing the interface methods, OAI repository implementations must have a no-arg constructor.

    XML namespace prefixes

    You will probably want to define your own namespace prefixes, like "oai_dc:" and "abcd:", rather than use the default prefixes generated by JAXB ("ns1:", "ns2:", etc.). This version of the library does not provide you with the means to do this programmatically. Thefore, you must update the package-info.java file in your jAXB package. Include an xmlns attribute within the @XmlSchema annotation that you see in the package-info.java file. Note that you must do this each time you generate your JAXB classes using xjc since this will also overwrite the package-info.java file. Example: 

     xmlns=@XmlNs(namespaceURI="http://example.com/some",prefix="xyz")
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • setConfiguration

        void setConfiguration(ConfigObject config)

      • setRepositoryBaseUrl

        void setRepositoryBaseUrl(String url)
        Informs the OAI repository under which URL it operates. OAI repositories may need this information to generate xsi:schemaLocation attributes. The repository base URL is the base URL of the OAI-PMH REST service plus the subsequent path segment(s) identifying the repository itself. So, if the base URL of the OAI-PMH REST service would be http://example.com/oaipmh, then the repository base URL would be http://example.com/oaipmh/repo-name or http://example.com/oaipmh/repo-group/repo-name. For example, for Geneious DNA extracts the repository base URL would be http://example.com/oaipmh/geneious/dna-extracts. Clients could then make requests for custom XSDs at this location: http://example.com/oaipmh/geneious/dna-extracts/xsd/<metadataPrefix>.xsd (e.g. http://example.com/oaipmh/geneious/dna-extracts/xsd/lims2.xsd). This location therefore is a valid value for the xsi:schemaLocation attribute for the lims2 namespace.
        Parameters:
        url -

      • getXSDForMetadataPrefix

        void getXSDForMetadataPrefix(OutputStream output,
                             String metadataPrefix)
                      throws RepositoryException
        Write the contents of the XML schema definition corresponding to the specified metadataPrefix to the specified output stream. This is especially meant to inform repository clients about custom XML schemas used, for example, within the oai_dc element.
        Parameters:
        output -
        metadataPrefix -
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

        Parameters:

      • getResumptionTokenParser

        IResumptionTokenParser getResumptionTokenParser()
        Provide a resumption token reader. Used to decompose a resumption token into its constituent parts. Implementations may return null, in which case the default parser is used.
        Returns:

      • done

        void done()
        Called just after a response has been sent back to the client. Allows repository implentations the close resources created for the request, if necessary.
